intro: Tricostularia guillauminii, commonly known as the Guillaumin's tricostularia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in areas with high altitudes and cool climates. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom during the spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
